result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph W Carter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay any balance remaining of the DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements; pay supervision fees. Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil jdugment entered against defendant which is non-dischargable in bankruptcy. Pay the surcharge, plus costs, disbursements and supervision fees to be taken from prison funds not to exceed 25%. Balance to be paid while on extended supervision. Court set restitution at zero as monies were recovered.
Court ordered defendant to have no contact with and be kept separate from co-defendant, Deshawn L. Peterson.

superMiscConds.notes:
Seek and maintain employment.
Be given job and vocational training.
Obtain high school diploma, HSED or GED.
Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession, body armor and Voting.

No contact with the victim, Ms. Debra M.,
No contact with K-Mart at 3201 North Mayfair Road, City of Wauwatosa, County of Milwaukee, Wisconsin.
No controlled substances or alcohol.
No contact with the co-defendant, Deshawn Peterson.

Urine screens.
Cognitive thinking intervention counseling.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-07-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joseph W Carter in court with attorney Gilbert Fielding Urfer.  Defendant Joseph W Carter in custody.  Jay R. Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant sworn as to his statements.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and enters a judgment of conviction.  Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession, body armor and Voting. 

Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 20.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.
Clerk:  jms

Attorney Gilbert F Urfer in court, defendant Joseph W Carter not in court, in custody.  Jay R Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 20.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gilbert F Urfer in court, defendant Joseph W Carter not in court, in custody.  Jay R Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request another scheduling date.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gilbert F Urfer in court, defendant Joseph W Carter not in court, in custody.  James W Frisch appeared on behalf of Jay R. Pucek for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Urfer has been appointed as new counsel from the Public Defender's Office and is now the attorney of record.  New scheduling date set.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
This clerk contacted the Felony Appointment Secretary of the Public Defender's Office via e-mail to have new counsel appointed.  Copy of e-mail in file. rn

Defendant Joseph W Carter in court with attorney Glenn O Givens.  Defendant Joseph W Carter in custody.  Jay R Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing does not proceed.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court  Case is adjourned for status of counsel.  Court instructed defense counsel to turn over all discovery and reports to the Public Defender's Office.  Status conference scheduled for May 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.  File retained in court.

Defendant Joseph W Carter in court with attorney Glenn O Givens.  Defendant Joseph W Carter in custody.  Jay R. Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Debria M
